definition[0]: to prevent something from growing or developing well
example[0]: An unhappy family life may inhibit childrenâ€™s learning.
definition[1]: to make someone feel embarrassed or nervous so that they cannot do or say what they want to
example[1]: Recording the meeting may inhibit people from expressing their real views.
definition[2]: to prevent something from growing or developing in the way that it could or being as good as it should be
example[2]: Air fares tend to be higher at airports where certain factors inhibit competition among airlines.
